intro: Pedicularis kiangsiensis, commonly known as the Kiangsi Lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant features showy, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, with a distinctive shape that attracts pollinators. It grows in rocky or alpine habitats, often in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
